review: I came here with a friend at high noon on a weekday and we got a table immediately. We placed our order at the same time we asked for our drinks and before our conversation could hit a lull our food was in front of us.  I got the Cheesy Bacon Cheeseburger - which is a bacon cheeseburger with a slab of fried cheese on it. (Whoever thought to put what is essentially a giant flat cheese-curd on a bacon cheeseburger should get a prize!) It was so good that I blew my "I am only eating half" rule out the door and gobbled the whole darn thing. The fries that came with it were good but a little too seasoned - my hands felt swollen from the salt later.  I am not a huge fan of TGI or any restaurant where the wearing of "Flair" is a common practice - I think I have watched Office Space one too many times - but I have to say lunch here was pretty nice. We had plenty of time to eat our meal and drink our drinks and made it back to work on time. I would not hesitate to have lunch here again.

New Years Day, we're still not eating meat before Nativity this Wed. We decided to stop here after we got 75% off a Christmas tree at Target in Roseville. I don't know why this address is listed in St. Paul,but it sure seems like Roseville. We got the cutest, most attentive waitress, and she was young and blond. My husband and I both ordered shrimp, his was deep-fried butterfly, listed as Friday's Shrimp, and I got Key West Shrimp, both delicious. This is really my favorite location.

When you're in the mood for American chain-restaurant food, this place will do the trick. Chicken tenders are quite good - batter is on the ligher, crispier side and honey mustard is sweet & delicious. It's also one of the only restaurants of its type that has the kitchen open super late -- good for late night cravings.
Good food, not great.  Cookie cutter layout.  All TGIF's are the same.
